name: generate-redcap-template
label: Generate Flywheel to Redcap Metadata Template
description: A gear to generate a YAML template to assist in transferring flywheel metadata to REDCAP
author: Loki, the trickster god

1a Add Rules for 'all subjects'.description: will add a section to the yaml file that is applied to all subjects

1b Populate every subject in project.description: will add a section to the yaml file for each subject

1c Add Rules for subject files.description: will add a section to the yaml file for files at the subject level

2a Add Rules for 'all sessions'.description: will add a section to the yaml file that is applied to all sessions

2b Populate every session in project.description: will add a section to the yaml file for each session

2c Add Rules for session files.description: will add a section to the yaml file for files at the session level

3a Add Rules for 'all acquisitions'.description: will add a section to the yaml file that is applied to all acquisitions

3b Populate every acquisition in project.description: will add a section to the yaml file for each acquisition

3c Add Rules for acquisition files.description: will add a section to the yaml file for files at the acquisition level

4a Redcap record ID variable name.description: the name of the variable in redcap that identifies the record ID

4b Container type that has redcap ID in.description: enter the name of the metadata field that has the redcap ID

4c Metadata field that contains redcap I.description: The name of the metadata field (On the container type specified in 4b) that has the redcap ID
